title: The Heart
creator_contributor_role: National Heart Foundation of Australia, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Health education
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Human physiology
description: Episode of Series "Help yourself to health". The human heart is a remarkable pump, averaging 72 beats a minute, pumping 7,000 litres of blood every day. Medical specialists explain the anatomy and physiology of the heart, the roles played by its valves and chambers as well as the electrical system which regulates the contraction of the heart muscle.
related_objects: Series; S01184; Help yourself to health; Active; 1987
